GClasses::GIncrementalTransform

GClasses::GIncrementalTransform Class Reference

This is the base class of algorithms that can transform data one row at a time without supervision. More...

#include <GTransform.h>

sp_relation & before ()
 train must be called before this method is used
sp_relation & after ()
 train must be called before this method is used
const double * afterMins ()
 enableIncrementalTraining must be called before this method is used. It returns a vector of minimum values for the data after the transform has been applied.
const double * afterRanges ()
 enableIncrementalTraining must be called before this method is used. It returns a vector of range values for the data after the transform has been applied.
virtual void transform (const double *pIn, double *pOut)=0
 pIn is the source row. pOut is a buffer that will hold the transformed row. train must be called before this method is used
virtual GData * doit (GData *pIn)
 This calls Train with pIn, then transforms pIn and returns the results.
virtual GData * transformBatch (GData *pIn)
 This assumes that train has already been called, and transforms all the rows in pIn.

double * m_pAfterRanges

Detailed Description

This is the base class of algorithms that can transform data one row at a time without supervision.

const double* GClasses::GIncrementalTransform::afterMins (  )  [inline]

enableIncrementalTraining must be called before this method is used. It returns a vector of minimum values for the data after the transform has been applied.

enableIncrementalTraining must be called before this method is used. It returns a vector of range values for the data after the transform has been applied.
